attributes.action: Post-Study Work Visa for International Students after completion of Course.
attributes.background: IISAU on behalf of all International students studying in the UK appeals to reintroduce post-study work visa for international students after completion of the degree program.
attributes.additional_details: Indian International students and Alumni Union is raising the voice for all International students in UK. The Migration Advisory Committee recommended an automatic period of leave to remain after studies complete. A post-study work visa would make the UK a more attractive destination for international students and graduates, enabling it to compete with other popular destinations such as the United States, Australia, and Canada who have more welcoming student visa policies.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Sensory Therapy to be offered in all areas
attributes.background:
My son has been denied sensory therapy recently, due to it not being commissioned in our area. This is due to there not being enough research to prove it's needed. 
My child, along with thousands of others need sensory therapy just as much as everyone needs access to a GP. 

This needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to the commisioners but had no joy, therefore I have taken this to the parliamentary ombudsman and I want to get as many signatures as possible to support my case and get our voices heard. 

Please sign. It takes 2 minutes but could help children for a lifetime.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Limit domestic construction working hours
attributes.background: (The Ctrl of Pollution Act 1974 gives Env Health powers to control noise on construction & demolition sites.Permitted hrs of work when noise can be audible at a construction site boundary:Mon-Fri 8am-6pm Sat 8am-1pm) Domestically a neighbour can drill,bang on an adjoining wall all night,no law
attributes.additional_details:
I want to make the law apply to domestic construction noise pollution, it shouldn't just apply to construction sites.  This should apply to disturbing noise domestically.  I have had to endure (for a year so far) drilling & banging up until 11pm, all day Sunday at times.
When your sleep and peace is impacted it causes real stress.The police informed me that my neighbour can drill & bang on my adjoining wall all night, there is no law.  This surely just isn't healthy

attributes.action: Add electric pet containment systems (‘invisible fences’) to the e-collar ban.
attributes.background:
The recent e-collar ban is fundamentally flawed in still permitting use of electric containment systems which make similar use of the fear- and pain-based so-called ‘training aid’. 
‘Invisible fences’ inflict the same aversive stimulus on pets, scientifically proven to negatively affect welfare.

attributes.action: Knife crime attacks to be reclassified as attempted murder.
attributes.background: In an effort to reduce the number of knife attacks and stabbings, reclassify stabbing another person as a minimum criminal charge of attempted murder upon that other person.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Close the legal loopholes in the High Hedges legislation
attributes.background: Part 8 of the Anti-Social Behaviour Act 2003 introduced legislation to combat the scourge of fast-growing evergreens like Leylandii which, when planted in a line as a hedge has blighted the lives of those living in neighbouring properties.
attributes.additional_details: A high hedge is defined as two or more evergreens, more that 2m tall planted in a line and where the branches meet so as to provide a barrier to light. Enforcement of high hedges legislation is the responsibility of councils.  However, the legislation does not cover individual trees and therefore people are merely cutting gaps in their hedges so that the former hedge becomes a line of individual trees which despite being large, cannot be dealt with by councils under the high hedges legislation.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for devolution in the North of England.
attributes.background: In 2004 the North East of England had a devolution referendum. Due to the small turnout the same referendum for the North West of England was never held. It is the opinion of many that the socio-economic divide between the North and the South of England has grown exponentially over the past decade.
attributes.additional_details: With growing cases of the North not having their issues and needs fairly addressed in the Southern biased Parliament, it is time that a referendum is held to offer those citizens North of the River Trent an opportunity to vote on devolution. This will provide a platform for issues relevant to the North of England to be considered without an underlying London-centricity.

attributes.action: Ban the use of horses within the police force
attributes.background: We want to ban the use of horses within the police force. Often the horses are put into dangerous and uncontrolled situations such as football games or marches which leads to distress for the animal. The horse is being exploited and is not having the freedom which we have and take for granted.
attributes.additional_details: I recently witnessed a Police horse struggling to walk, looking in pain along with acting distressed as it walked down a busy main road in Manchester. It is unfair and there are other means the Police could have used such as bikes, as this was a quiet Wednesday evening there was no need to have the horse out. The policeofficer was not able to control the situation in a calm & effective manner to which the horse would be taken out of the dangerous situation for both the horse and the public.

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action: No prescription charges in England
attributes.background: I believe the people of England should not have to pay for a  prescription.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the people who reside in England should have the same rights as anywhere within the UK.  Unfortunately England is the only Country within the UK that pays for prescriptions, I find this a form of discrimination, we the people of England demand the same rights as the other 3 Countries within the UK.

attributes.action: Forbid payment of any money to the EU if the UK has no properly elected MEPs.
attributes.background: Whilst the UK is an EU member, permanently or in transition, she must not be allowed to make any financial payments to the EU unless the UK is represented by properly elected, not appointed, MEPs in the EU parliament. Primary legislation must be passed to prevent "taxation without representation"
attributes.additional_details:
The European Union has made plans to reallocate British MEP seats to other existing member states after 29th March 2019 and has failed to confirm UK elected MEPs will fill those seats if the EU and the UK government extend Britain's EU membership after that date.

It can not be allowed that British tax payers' money passes to an organisation for which the UK people have no parliamentary representation.

attributes.action: Allow students to have open book exams and supported with equations and formulae
attributes.background: more and more students are increasingly struggling to get a grip on the new GCSE format students are being made to memorise hundreds of different quotes from multiple books and poems
attributes.additional_details:
whilst also remembering key dates and theories in other subjects this is extremely challenging as it is becoming more about the memory skill rather than knowledge . furthermore a students are required to remember several different equations for subjects like maths and science this is beyond a students capacity and is overwhelming to the students health and well being . Anxiety and depression is most common amongst young people due to exam stress and revision . 
There needs to be a drastic change

attributes.action: Reduce vat on head lice treatment
attributes.background: Since the demise of the "nit nurse" in schools in the 1990's and the withdrawal of free NHS prescription for treatment's in 2018. Head lice are becoming more prevalent. Parents need some support, reducing expences would mean more parents could afford to treat successfully
attributes.additional_details:
Schools offer no advice or support to parents.

Doctors no longer prescribe on the NHS

Head Lice can cause stress  anxiety,loss of sleep and bullying. 

It is an unpleasant infection.

attributes.action: Cap private housing rent based on the house value
attributes.background:
Private housing rent costs are through the roof!! No longer is it affordable to cover rent and have money spare for millions of people in the UK.
Landlords in the UK are making it impossible for low paid workers to get a better future for their family.
attributes.additional_details:
What's suggested is a Maximum cap based on the house value, most importantly low value housing costing under £250,000. A maximum rent of £500 per month is more than sufficient for the landlord to not only cover costs but still very profitable.
This WILL help millions of people in the UK better off and have a better living standard.

attributes.action: Stop car insurers hiking premiums for 'non-fault'  or 'notification only' cases
attributes.background: I recently received my renewal invitation. They had hiked my premiums by nearly 3x. They told me that it was because I had notified them March last year that someone had smashed my windscreen. I did not make a claim. They had classed the notification as an 'at fault claim'. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
"Admiral is one insurer that bumps up premiums after just one non-fault accident. It claims it is justified in doing so because those involved in one are more likely to be involved in another accident later on. 

"By having a non-fault claim our customers fall into a category that we see as a higher risk to insure."

‘We rate on the fact an incident has occurred, whether they have claimed or not.’

Original article:
https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/cars/article-3052191/How-drivers-insurance-costs-soar-no-fault-accidents-don-t-claim.html

It has to stop. The industry needs tighter regulations against this kind of profiteering, as that's what I, and a LOT of drivers see it as

attributes.action: Winter Tyres should be compulsory from October - April,
attributes.background: It's that time of year when temperatures start to plunge and drivers should be switching to winter tyres to avoid being caught out by snow and ice on the roads. Winter tyres can cut accidents and give you much better grip on the road even in wet condition
attributes.additional_details: There is a difference between summer and winter tyres. Winter tyres are made of a different rubber compound with a high silica content which makes them softer and tread pattern has small slits in the tread blocks so they grip the road better, and allow you to safely brake on snow and ice. Drivers are better off with winter tyres whenever the temperature dips below 7C. Cars with winter tyres have significantly shorter braking distances about 20 percent on wet surfaces a little longer on snow/ice

attributes.action: Stop all hospital car parking charges
attributes.background: Hospital car parking charges
attributes.additional_details: Why should our nurses have to pay to go to work to look after the sick and the dying and why should we have to pay if we are sick?

attributes.action: Introcude machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid
attributes.background: Encourage the government to install recyclable machines in the supermarkets to recycle pet bottles, cans and get paid in vouchers, this would encourage customers to recycle and get paid for that’s, that’s a win for win.
attributes.additional_details: In my recent trip to Germany I went to a supermarket and realised that they have machines installed across every single supermarket that’s encourages customers to recycle pet bottles and cans, furthermore they get vouchers from the supermarket that reduces their daily shopping costs by just recycling their cans and bottles. living in the uk, this is a must it’s win-win for both sides, customers bring the materials and get paid, the government reduced the plastic cost and reuses the old plastic.

attributes.action: Kids can drive at the age of 16
attributes.background:
If this goes into place then kids won't need a excuse for being late to school /college and will be able to travel to school then take transport which
1.won't be as packed which will cause less arguments/ fights
2.will also give kids experience for jobs in the future.

attributes.action: Provide funding for school children to access leisure centres or gyms
attributes.background: Leisure centre memberships are expensive and many families cannot afford them. This is why I think pupils from primary to end of secondary schools should be provided with them. First to motivate more children to get into sports and to get fitter and to resolve Britain’s immense problem with obesity.
attributes.additional_details:
Did you know that in England the prevalence of overweight and obesity is above 70% among all age groups from 45 upwards.
 
For more information go visit https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN03336/SN03336.pdf

attributes.action: Increase the Minimum wage for Under 18's, because it is too low to cover costs
attributes.background: The current UK minimum wage is £4.20. It violates rights for under 18's. And its harder for young adults to be able to save and invest. It creates boundaries. There are many costs which they cannot cover. Prices for food, drinks and clothes have gone up. So why cant the price of hourly wage go up.
attributes.additional_details: Currently most UK teenagers are being forced to work for £4.20 an hour. Some of those cannot provide enough to support their families. The cost for living has gone up. Its more expensive to live in this day and era. The price of a cup of coffee is £3.50. The price of daily necessities has increased rapidly. More and more families are becoming vulnerable, and parents of those young workers may not be able to provide for them. So they get a job. But £4.20 an hour is the price of peanuts.

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum life sentence for rape
attributes.background: In 2003 its estimated there were 50,000 rapes every year. 600 sent to jail on average. If this isn’t ridiculous then.. There will be no change if we don’t start by helping the people in the world. Victims have a life sentence, so should the perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Raping someone is as bad as killing someone, because no one recovers from that. There is not enough justice for victims. Rapists do time and then are back out in the world to do it again. This needs to change and this is a start.

attributes.action: Completely divest from fossil fuels and end fossil fuel subsidies
attributes.background: With overwhelming evidence that global warming is human-caused and posing a significant threat to the lives of millions, the UK government must lead the world in ending investment and subsidies for the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Some articles on the subject:
https://www.ft.com/content/318f85c8-85ea-11e8-96dd-fa565ec55929
https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/jan/10/new-york-city-plans-to-divest-5bn-from-fossil-fuels-and-sue-oil-companies
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/jan/23/uk-has-biggest-fossil-fuel-subsidies-in-the-eu-finds-commission
https://climate.nasa.gov/evidence/

attributes.action: Give people who are partially sighted medical exemption certificates for lenses.
attributes.background: When I was 6 months old I was diagnosed with cataracts, I had both natural lenses removed, registering me partially sighted. This left me having to wear very strong lenses, -18 prescription. Without lenses I would be unable to see, to be able to see I have to pay £100 each year for the privilege.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK some medical conditions are eligible for a 'medical exemption certificate' which means that they do not need to pay for the day to day treatment of their condition. One of the criteria which will make you eligible is having "a continuing physical disability which means you cannot go out without the help of another person"(NHS website). Without my lenses I would struggle to live my life the way I do now, it would limit what I could do inside and outside the house. It is not a choice.

attributes.action: Make law for dogs to be insured for damage injury to humans and other species
attributes.background: In order to make people more responsible for dog ownership make it law for all dogs to be covered  against injury death damage to humans to other species and property

attributes.action: Change the Help to Buy rule of owning a property or share of one abroad.
attributes.background: My wife & I are British Citizens. Originally from abroad, we have family who still there. We are trying to buy a house through one the Government's Help-To-Buy Schemes but don't qualify because unfortunately my mother died and left me a share of her property in her will.
attributes.additional_details: The law of the country says I cannot give my share away to any of the heirs and trying to sell it to a third party individual is near impossible given the risks and future shared ownership with private individuals of the property. This continues to disqualify my family & I from the Help-To-Buy Schemes.

attributes.action: Stop NI contributions affected by the 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts
attributes.background: 1995 and 2011 Pension Acts means thousands will have worked for over 50 years by the time they reach SPa. This petition ensures some financial compensation for this group of women by ceasing NI contribution for those women who would have made sufficient contribution before they reach SPa.
attributes.additional_details: I cannot provide accurate evidence of the number of women affected by this proposal. However, in my own situation and hearsay evidence from women in my age group this change would mean that the last year or few years before reaching SPa, some women would benefit financially albeit they may pay additional tax on the additional money not deducted by  NI contributions.

attributes.action: Recognise National Assembly leader Juan Guaidó as acting president of Venezuela.
attributes.background: In May 2018, Venezuela held presidential elections that were condemned as "neither free nor fair" by the UK. In 2019 Nicolás Maduro was sworn-in as President. But the Venezuelan Constitution states that the president of the National Assembly must take office temporarily until new elections are held.
attributes.additional_details: Venezuela, a country that was once a stable democracy and a strong economy, is now plagued by a dictatorial regime that is starving its citizens, stands accused by the UN Human Rights Commissioner of systematically murdering and torturing protesters, and has triggered the biggest refugee crisis in the history of the Americas.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of university tuition fees.
attributes.background: We are starting to view universities that look great to us with the subjects we want to study but the tuition fees are a big factor and we’ve realised that they shouldn’t cost £9,250 so help us lower this and help more people attend university.

attributes.action: Funded places in nurseries for children with disabled parents!
attributes.background: For 10 months I have been trying to find affordable childcare for my daughter. I have Cystic Fibrosis and spend long periods in hospital. People cannot keep taking time off to look after her and I simply cannot afford that amount of money. There needs to be an option for disabled parents!!
attributes.additional_details: Sometimes parents with disabilities/invisible illnesses need time on hospital and for people like me with little family it can be hard to find affordable childcare. I myself cannot work, therefore have limited funds. I think there should be an option for some free hours/place at nurseries from birth instead of just the 2 year funding, my disability effects my daughter from birth. What Should I do if no one can have her? I need an option to fall back on and no other services can help me!

attributes.action: Allow Polish people freedom of movement after the Brexit.
attributes.background: We owe the Polish for fighting the Germans in WW2 in the air and on the ground. This is fact.
attributes.additional_details: The Polish are very patriotic people and should be allowed with open arms into the UK.

attributes.action: Reintroduce a reformed national service. (Not just the military)
attributes.background: I feel that service in all areas of the nation will aid not only the country but the people serving it. It will teach life skills and discipline, something that is lacking in today’s society. It will also help to reduce selfishness in future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
2 years in one of the armed forces or emergency services. (This gives time to finish higher education and apprenticeships)
 
For those not eligible to join the services or choosing not to: 2 years as an apprentice tradesman or care worker.

attributes.action: Urge Bank of England to remove tallow (cow flesh) from new £20 and £50 notes
attributes.background: The new, polymer £20 and £50 note denominations are set to continue using tallow (cow flesh) as a component. This is UNACCEPTABLE to the current 3.5 million vegans, 7 million vegetarians, 817,000 Hindus and many others in the UK who all oppose the slaughter of cows.
attributes.additional_details:
This is over 17% of the UK population!

NUMBER OF VEGANS AND VEGETARIANS IN THE UK:
 
https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/food-and-drink/vegans-uk-rise-popularity-plant-based-diets-veganism-figures-survey-compare-the-market-a8286471.html
 
(https://www.comparethemarket.com/car-insurance/content/cars-against-humanity/)
 
NUMBER OF HINDUS IN THE UK:
 
https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/culturalidentity/religion/articles/religioninenglandandwales2011/2012-12-11

attributes.action: Ban sugar in Leisure Centres, Hospitals & all other places that promote health.
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to tackle obesity so, in places that are meant to be promoting health, a total ban on sugared products would quite simply just make sense. Being able to buy a chocolate bar and fully sugared drink in a gym is a total contradiction of its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Sugar is the number 1 cause of children being admitted to hospital in the U.K. for oral problems. Type 2 diabetes has never been so abundant. High street stores are having to change their sizing criteria. Education is the most powerful tool in which you can change the world but when no one is properly educating and no one is properly listening, removing choice is the only way to get proper results.

attributes.action: Make all drone pilots subject to licensing and create a register of owners
attributes.background: With the danger posed by some irresponsible drone pilots, the govt should pass laws to regulate purchases of these items, licence pilots after they have passed a proficiency test, have registration documents for each drone and have gps tracking fitted so that a flight log is maintained.
attributes.additional_details: Yet again we have flight delays due to irresponsible owners flying drones close to airports.  We have already had drones flying dangerously close to aircraft and, apart from the inconvenience that is experienced by the public due to this, it is a real threat to human life.

attributes.action: Dissolve
attributes.background:
Dissolution is the official term for the end of a Parliament. 25 days after a successful motion to dissolve a general election must be held.
Members of parliament in all parties fear the result of a general election too much to table the motion so we, the people, must demand it to see it happen.
attributes.additional_details:
"On a motion to dissolve the Parliament then in existence dissolves at the beginning of the 25th working day before the polling day for the next parliamentary general election as determined under section 1 or appointed under section 2(7)" Fixed-term Parliament Act of 2011.
The Government does not resign when Parliament is dissolved. Government ministers remain in charge of their departments but may not after the result of the election is known and a new administration is formed.

attributes.action: Make a governmental apology for the massacre at Jalianwala Bagh (Amritsar 1919)
attributes.background: April 2019 will mark 100 Years since the bloody Vaisakhi of 1919 when a massacre was carried against the people of Punjab in which several hundreds at least lost their lives. We must never forget the tyranny of the 'Butcher of Amritsar' General Reginald Dyer.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election in April 2019.
attributes.background: The UK populace deserves to have a people’s vote, on which UK Party, will lead us into the future. After we leave the European Union. Give people a choice on what party will take over after 29th March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the Conservative Party, should allow this. As they have made a bit of a catastrophe out of this whole Brexit ordeal. They owe us that much. Please allow an April 2019 - UK General Election.

attributes.action: Propose that the European Union be disband.
attributes.background: Greece is bankrupt, Italy is bankrupt, Spain, Cyprus and now France are all on the brink on bankruptcy. Why do people want us to remain when we are going lose all money within a couple of months.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2012/06/18/abandon-eu/ 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/may/26/danger-brexit-break-up-eu-europe-russia 
https://www.debate.org/opinions/should-the-european-union-be-dissolved

attributes.action: Review racially discriminatory Gang Matrix(ces) obedience to human rights laws.
attributes.background: The Gang Matrix launched by Trident Gang Command is a system that has been found to disproportionately target BAME young men in their relation, or lack thereof, to gang crime. Information is often shared with other authorities limiting their access to opportunities and their chances of success.
attributes.additional_details:
The Metropolitan Police Service Gangs Violence Matrix and other similar Matrices should be dismantled, unless police services can demonstrate that they have been brought in line with international human rights law, in particular, the right to non-discrimination, privacy and family life, as contained in international human rights law. 
For further details read the recommendations highlighted in Amnesty International report: https://www.amnesty.org.uk/files/reports/Trapped%20in%20the%20Matrix%20Amnesty%20report.pdf

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: Ban (military grade armour piercing) 0.50 or higher calibre rifles in the UK
attributes.background:
Despite the overwhelming support for strict gun control in the United Kingdom the Government is failing to ban certain military-grade guns in its new Offensive Weapons Bill.

This is unacceptable and places the British public at direct risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/offensiveweapons.html

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-politics-46377250

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/government-ban-50-caliber-offensive-weapons-bill-sajid-javid-violence-a8657046.html

attributes.action: Call to ban ‘cruel’ pupil restraint in special schools
attributes.background: Hundreds of children have suffered injuries while being physically restrained in special schools. Teachers throw children to the ground, hold them so tightly it still hurts the next day and don’t talk to them when they are in distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Something has to be done. 
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39530915
